results.title: Walt Whitman's Civil War
results.creator_credit: Frederic Goodich, Magus Films and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Walt Whitman (played by Will Geer) moves through now-deserted fields remembering the “long solemn trenches”, the wounded, the dead, the thousands of personal tragedies of “The War of Attempted Secession”. Poems such as “Ashes of Soldiers” and “The Artilleryman’s Vision” are interspersed with his eye witness prose accounts of the war from the sound track and present the majesty and power of Whitman’s style. Archive photographs and filmed representations of the war are also featured.

results.title: Walt Disney Movie Viewer Cartridge [Snow White]
results.brief_description:
Walt Disney Movie Viewer
The first Movie Viewer was made in the USA in 1973 by Fisher Price. The British version was made by the Mettoy company. The viewer used Super 8 film and the actual clips were short pieces from real cartoon films. No technology was required to operate the viewer, not even batteries. The hand crank enabled the operator to view the film at any speed with the ability to go forwards or backwards at will.

results.title: Walls and walls
results.brief_description: A story about walls, literally, symbolically, and psychologically. Contains some animated scenes and footage, stills, historical footage. Experimental film made up of a montage of images, including two dancers in live action. Dancers: Jerry Baden, Wendy Ziegler.

results.title: Wallace and Gromit: 3 cracking adventures = A Grand day out. The Wrong trousers. A Close shave [DVD]
results.brief_description: Three delightful animated claymation shorts from director Nick Park and the studios of Aardman Animation, all featuring the hapless inventor Wallace and his faithful dog, Gromit. “A grand day out”: Wallace likes a nice bit of cheese with his crackers, so when the eccentric inventor finds his fridge empty and the local corner shop shut for Bank Holiday, he is forced to look further afield for his cheddar. The two plasticine heroes blast off in their home-made rocket on the ultimate day-trip to the Moon! “The Wrong trousers”: A hilarious tale of skulduggery involving an extraordinary pair of automated trousers and a villainous penguin. Posing as an innocent lodger, the fiendish fish-eater sets about recruiting mild-mannered Wallace as unwitting accomplice to his dastardly plot; a diamond heist. It is left to the faithful Gromit to turn detective and save the day as malice and mayhem culminate in a breathless train chase around the sitting room. “A Close shave”: Trade is booming for Wallace and Gromit’s window cleaning Wash’N’Go service and love is in the air as Wallace falls for the owner of the local wool shop, the lovely Wendolene Ramsbottom. However, Wallace has a new invention - a Knit-O-Matic machine - and adventure looms; sheep are being rustled, wool is in short supply and Wendolene’s malevolent pooch is on the prowl. All three shorts also available separately on VHS.

results.title: Wallace & Gromit: the wrong trousers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nick Park, Christopher Moll and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Once again our plasticine heroes are plunged into a hilarious tale of skullduggery involving an extraordinary pair of automated trousers and a villanous penguin. Posing as an innocent lodger, the fiendish fish-eater sets about recruiting mild-mannered Wallace as unwitting accomplice to his dastardly plot; a diamond heist. It is left to the faithful Gromit to turn detective and save the day as malice and mayhem culminate in a breathless train chase around the sitting room.
